channel.title: PouchDB
channel.description: PouchDB, the JavaScript Database that Syncs!

item.title: PouchDB 3.3.1: A quick one while he's away
item.dc:creator: Nolan Lawson
item.description: This is a quick release, ahead of our normal monthly release schedule, to fix some critical bugs and ship them out sooner to our eager PouchDB fanbase.

item.title: PouchDB 3.3.0: Fix Up, Look Sharp
item.dc:creator: Dale Harvey
item.description: A new month means a new PouchDB release. Over the last month we have been looking around the rough edges and cleaning things up or chopping them off along with the usual slew of bugfixes and a lot of great news.

item.title: PouchDB 3.2.1: You can always be faster
item.dc:creator: Nolan Lawson
item.description: A humble release to ring in the new year, PouchDB 3.2.1 is focused on bugfixes and performance improvements. In particular, 3.2.1 boasts some critical fixes for IE11 and node-webkit, as well as a fix for replication of conflicted documents.

item.title: The Pains Of Being Async At Heart
item.dc:creator: Dale Harvey
item.description: If you are testing JavaScript you will likely have to test against async API's. These bring up some issues that you may not be familiar with if you are used to testing synchronous code. Here are a few things I have learnt working on the PouchDB test suite.

item.title: PouchDB 3.2.0: To code is human, to debug is divine
item.dc:creator: Nolan Lawson
item.description: Hot on the heels of the last release, we present 3.2.0, which has new features to increase developer productivity, as well as a slew of bugfixes.

item.title: How we test PouchDB
item.dc:creator: Dale Harvey
item.description: While working on and researching improvements for automated testing in PouchDB, I found a lack of blog posts and general information about how open-source libraries test themselves. With PouchDB, a huge amount of effort has gone into testing, but we haven't talked about it much outside the project. So I wanted to explain a little about our approach.

item.title: PouchDB 3.1.0: A Guide to Recognizing Your Marsupials (The PouchDB Guide)
item.dc:creator: Dale Harvey
item.description: Today marks the dawn of a new PouchDB release, 3.1.0 is released today with a whole bunch of goodness. Here are some of the highlights:

item.title: 10 things I learned from reading (and writing) the PouchDB source
item.dc:creator: Nolan Lawson
item.description: In the spirit of Paul Irish, here's a list of some surprising things I learned while reading (and writing) the PouchDB source code.

item.title: PouchDB 3.0.6: Safari Madness
item.dc:creator: Nolan Lawson
item.description: As Cupertino fans snuggle up to their bigger and better iDevices, PouchDB users will appreciate PouchDB 3.0.6. This release contains a workaround for some unforeseen hiccups in Apple's new implementation of IndexedDB for Safari 7.1 and iOS 8.

item.title: PouchDB 3.0.5: Turtles All the Way Down
item.dc:creator: Nolan Lawson
item.description: Tonight our fine dining selection is PouchDB 3.0.5, which fixes some issues with excessive recursion and also PouchDB.sync not always working correctly.
